summary: A bestselling female novelist, suffering from writer's block, hires an innocent young woman to watch over her twin children. As the novelist dangerously indulges in her new best seller, the line between the life she's writing and the one she's living becomes blurred.

reviews.content: Bland, banal. Whatever the makers had in mind, it fell absolutely flat.

Very weak movie. At the minute 1:40 small girl with knife can easily kill huge strong man who can't do nothing….))))
Mary understood from Grace aunt about disorders of Grace but when she enter home she did not try to kick her out she left kids and run to see husband rather then call police advance. 

She wrote book on the price of dead friend…. 
Everyone used each other for sex, for fun, for the success of writing book 
Adm at the end of the movie sitting having fun and playing cards as nothing happened 
Never recommended movie.
has to be one of the worst movie's I've ever seen, avoid at all costs
This movie is a complete mess! Full of holes and bad visual and sound effects.
This movie felt like it was 10 hours long. It doesn't even give you the slight satisfaction of having a cheap plottwist.
I am still wondering if this is satire, and I just didn't realise. It just seems you couldn't make something this bad without trying to.

Worst movie I've seen in a while.
Thats a 119 minutes of my life I wont get back. Atrocious scripting, like it was written by an amateur under the age of 12. More holes in the plot than Swiss cheese! The ended made no sense, and don't even get me started on the acting! If youre thinking of watching this movie....save yourself a whole lot of regret! Don't bother.

eh; i didn't hate it - i thought i had it pegged from the previews, which turned out i did not. i couldn't get over the mom's behavior even before the weird stuff started happening. the storyline picks up when the weird stuff starts, though, which was welcomed. but eventually it seemed like they were trying to split off too many branches & then it just got messy, idk. i don't think it's a bad watch - it has a great cast - but i also didn't love it.
nice story, interesting
Don't bother.  I was sucked in by the allure of new content on Netflix and it's #2 rating on Netflix at the time.  The story and acting were ham-fisted at best.
Terrible lame thrills. Predicable story from the very beginning. Thank you Netflix

I'm not sure whether the director was sure on which way to tie off this story. I love watching movies with ambiguous ending, but I'm not sure this movie can fall under that umbrella. Most plot points are unnecessary convoluted. The acting certainly didn't solve the issue either. Seems like the director's vision was to make a movie that makes people talk about it after the ending.
The Shittest movie I've ever seen totally waste of time.I bet if Marry Played by 6 years old girl it would've been better acting.
Truly terrible. Everything about it was awful. The story sucked. The acting sucked. How did this thing get made?

A reasonably happy family with twins has need of a nanny so that the protagonist Mary writes a fresh novel to compensate the financial loss by her husband Tom.

Grace, the babysitter has been liked by the twins, Tom suggests his wife to make her part of the family, Mary agrees.

The audience watches Grace seducing both Mary and Tom separately ; it is harmless until the anniversary day of marriage.

The so called dangerous illusions are revealed when Elain, a friend of Mary who watched Tom and Grace together and tried to warn Mary about that is found killed with scissors having fingerprints of her to make her the prime suspect; Mary inquires into background of Grace to find that she has history of being abused, reaches home to face climax with Grace who , apparently taken over by her another personality, namely, Margaret stabbed her husband. Margaret and Mary fight, and Mary defends herself by hitting Margaret over the head with a flower pot.

The poignant dialogue is spoken by Grace,about Margaret, her evil half ,she says 'I couldn't stop her'.

As a psycho sexual comedy the movie may be watched, there is no deep impact except eroticism between the husband, wife and the babysitter.
Soooo slow ,,predictable and is better on Lifetime than Netflix!! I mean WTH Netflix!?

1 out of 5 stars. Horrible psychological thriller film about a writer having writers block. Hires a nanny to watch over her kids. But when she becomes attracted to her and starts having illusions of whats real or not. Dumb plot that tries to keep you guessing. Even the twist is forgettable. The story feels like a bad lifetime movie. The acting is stale with the cast ensemble. The direction is dumb. And dull. This is one film worth passing.
accidentally watched this. jeez. should be able to sue writers for wasted time.
This movie was SO bad. The story was bad. The acting was bad. The idea... Was BAD. Honestly should be a B movie or worse.
Oh my God... this sucks... can't even start to describe how poorly it's written.

IN A NUTSHELL:
I was intrigued to watch this movie because I'm an author and author coach. The film's description says: After a bestselling novelist suffering from writer's block hires a new nanny for her children, the line between fiction and reality starts to blur. It's a psychological, erotic thriller that is so badly executed that I'm giving you fair warning here.

THINGS I LIKED:
Fans of Sex and the City will be excited to see Kristin Davis starring in a feature film. Unfortunately, she's not a strong enough actress to save this film. Her character is conflicted in many ways. I thought it was sweet that, as a mom, she had different handshakes to say goodbye to each of her kids when she dropped them off at school.
Greer Grammer stars in the movie and also produces it.
I liked the original musical soundtrack by Drum & Lace.
Every author's writing process is different. In the movie, we see Kristen Davis' character writing her book with pen and paper, rather than on a computer. I have some author clients who do that. We also see her create a storyboard on a big board, a technique I recommend to my clients because it really helps you "see" the story develop and allows you to be very intentional where you place certain scenes.
Husbands and wives need to be extremely careful in order to protect their marriage from external relationships and impropriety. For example, my husband NEVER drove home our female babysitters. It wasn't that I didn't trust him or our sweet babysitters. Too many crazy things can happen based on what other people think could have happened, you know? It's just not worth it. No, people shouldn't assume or judge, yet they do.

THINGS I DIDN'T LIKE:
Even the title isn't original. So many books have been written with the same name.
I'm surprised that Dermot Mulroney went for this script.
Weird and creepy. I mean who takes a complete stranger bra shopping? That's the first scene when you realize the movie is ridiculous and it just gets worse.
It's often hard to know what's really happening and what's fantasy. Of course, that's the point because the protagonist can't either. Then again, the execution and writing are so bad that it makes you wonder if the writer and director even knew.
There are some really terrible acting moments.
There's a terribly cliched flower moment.
Lots of exposition.
There are twists but they're ridiculous with so many details that don't make sense. We're left with more questions because Act 3 is a complete mess.
There were some "Gollum" moments that made me laugh out loud. (The psycho hobbit in the Lord of the Rings)

TIPS FOR PARENTS:
This movie is NOT appropriate for children. Plus, they'll be bored anyway.
You see a married couple rolling around under the sheets. Then later, they do it in a kitchen closet.
You see some skin when two best friends are in a spa sauna & shower.
A pretty girl wears an immodest bathing suit. You see her in a bra many times.
The mom smokes cigars as a symbol of her warped and developing manly obsessions of a young girl.
A woman goes skinny dipping in the pool. Later, you see part of her naked chest in a bathtub.
Tons of inappropriate sexual illusions.
Two women kiss.
You see some blood in a murder scene.
Some profanity, crude language, and an F-bomb
You see the naked backside of a man in a shower
Violence.

You can see my full review on my Movie Review Mom YouTube channel!

This film is special because it intrigues and entertains you for much of the film and then shows you a really ugly ending. Besides that most of the twists are trivial and non-trivial ones have no sense
The editing of this movie sucks. The story is good but the acting and the way some of the scenes unfold is such a turnoff. Don't waste your time..
Yet another piece of ableist bullcrap depicting people with DID as scary murderers. Absolutely disgusting.

I absolutely loved this movie and I'm shocked by the bad reviews! First of all I love how they focused on the women's relationship. It was well done and believable and I didn't need to see explicit sexual stuff for it to be erotic. I thought the acting was great, I didn't think it was drawn out, and it honestly kept me guessing throughout the whole movie including the ending, which can sometimes be irritating but in this case it was kind of cool. Without giving away too many spoilers. So I think anyone who loves thriller movies who don't mind a mostly female cast then this is definitely a watch for you.
Bad acting.  Really Bad story.

Not only is the acting terrible, the story line is flat and tries desperately to be thrilling and fails miserably. The lead actress fails in every scene and is not convincing nor engaging. What a waste of a couple of precious hours.

Literally the worst movie I've ever seen. Trite, predictable, bad acting, it's got it all, in the bad way. I'm extra bummef to see Kristen Davis settle for such a wretched script. Believe the reviews and save yourself an hour and a half.
Just a simple twist on the new, sexy nanny story, and you think you're changing the genre. Nope, not at all. Predictable yet palpable enough to fold my laundry too.

Oh come on everybody, you're missing the point! Sometimes one just has to fess up that a movie has been made to ENTERTAIN, not to set a new high water benchmark in movie making achievement. I was entertained, and well so.
About as pleasant and well written as a toddler who thinks his excrement is a pen

The usual babysitter gaslights parents.  For a start, the woman's behaviour towards her employee is grossly inappropriate from the beginning and its hard to understand her motives.  Very one dimensional.  Also hard to identify with these unsympathetic characters.
A must see. Greer is a fucking bad bitch. And charlotte shows tits

It was interesting to see women writer, director and producers conspire to make a movie worthy of half a star and every bit as terrible as any men could possibly conceive.  Oddly though, I watched till the end, the last fifteen minutes of which were certifiably horrible.

The worst representation of D.I.D, lesbians, and an overall horrible horrible movie to top it all off. The movie has you going "wtf" the entire time and didn't even end well or tie up any loose ends. 1/10 would not watch.

This is the best movie ever! It has to be an avant garde take on every trope for the babysitter drama. I have to believe the dialog, story, and directorial decisions were all done intentionally. 5.. EFFING.. STARS..!! I will die on this hill.
Yeah this whole thing was absolute horse shit. Terrible writing, terrible acting, terrible everything.

Deadly Illusions is about as bad as you’d expect. The acting is all around terrible. Kristin Davis was awful, and Greer Grammer is somehow worse. Look, I had no expectations going into this. I just wanted it to be funny bad. And yet is somehow fails at that. The film is nearly two hours long, and it should’ve been shorter. The film also makes absolutely zero sense, especially with its bonkers ending. I’ll be honest though, I was laughing a good amount during the climax, so I don’t think I can give this a 1/2 star rating. Still, this was horrible in many ways. Overall, this was trash, but I really hope you know that already. Even if you’re looking for trashy fun this doesn’t even rise to that level.
I don't know why the rating for this movie is so low, I absolutely loved it and watched it twice in 2 days!!! This is an absolute must see!!! Plus it's hella sexy!!! 10/10 would definitely recommend!

It's SO disappointing to see a cast of actors I've enjoyed in the past get together and make a stinker like this.  The overuse of the "is it real or is it a dream.." sequences are symptoms of weak writing and trigger my eye roll on the couch.  This film has way too many flaws and I feel sorry for the poor editors that had to try and save this awful acting.  BTW, Kristin Davis is a smokin' hottie in my book but not even her steamy scenes from this movie can make it even watchable in my book. Sorry Kristin if you read this - you look better than ever.
Average. Some awkward sexual scenes and a muddled plot ruin what could have been a classic thriller.
Need to kill a couple hours and can't find anything else to watch? It'll do. But don't go out of your way to see it.

Yeah it's pretty bad. Was ok for the first half, a bit slow moving, but the ending was just terrible. Badly written, badly acted, badly edited. Just... not even the good kind of bad that's entertaining. Just bad.

pk,ok, what can I say!!

This is what Netflix is on this days.
If it the acting and plot were twice as bad, this movie might actually be somewhat better.  I had more than a couple of headslap chuckles.
The acting was terrible and the storyline was predictable. I do not recommend it.

It's intensely erotic and tends to focus on the steam more than the actual plot.
You can probably skip this one - 2/10

Incredibly bad acting .... nonsensical plot ...illogical tempo ...ridiculous anticlimactic ending ...this movie is the most unnecessary thing in the history of unnecessary things. Why Netfix ? Why ???!
This made me so angry that I signed up to Rotten Tomatoes just to express  how insulted I feel. Possible the worst movie I've ever seen. Avoid! I would like to explain why but... it's everything.

Deadly Illusions is an erotic thriller that is lite on the thrill side. It's very cliche and cheesy in parts but has more than enough to keep you watching. Netflix is issuing these TV movies for fun. Dead average.
Very disappointing movie.  It had some potential, but fell flat with a story line and characters that were not developed enough.

What MAN wrote this movie?  One that things women just love to get naked and kiss each other when they are alone.  We just love to get naked and swim too.  This movie was sexist, disgusting, and absolutely boring.  Worst movie I have seen all year.

Rotten cannot even begin to describe how horrendous this movie was. Did they pay these actors to perform so badly? Could they not even see from reading how ridiculous this script was? Talk about painful.

It sucked. Don't waste your time. Kristen Davis' acting is worse than ever. It's always been bad, but this is THE WORST. None of the unknown wannabe actors can bring their characters to any level of believability. The so called "twist" at the end is laughable.
Cheesy, predictable, poorly acted and really bad. Don't waste your time watching this movie....
Comically horrendous
Really sad that 2 great actors resorted to such a terrible film.

Started off with a good premise,
'Who's actually the crazy one?' 'Who's playing who?'
Then after that first ten minutes it turned into trope soup. The big reveal wasn't a reveal of anything, just lots of new information crammed into five minutes. I have some video of my grass growing which is better than this if you'd like to see it?
Really bad movie with confusing ending. Way too long and boring
Oh wow it's so bad. So so so bad. Horrible acting, preposterous plot holes and ludicrous dialogue. I don't know why they made this movie and I don't know why I watched it for over an hour...
DO NOT watch this movie. It's pretentiously disgusting. Nothing in here to rescue. I'm sorry but for real, its a joke.

I wish I could give this zero stars! This movie had so much potential but instead it was lazy writing and a very low budget movie... I'm just angry that I wasted my time and so much hope... I don't even know why Netflix even wasted its money. The lack of character development, there wasn't any suspense- honestly it was laughable. I figured out the movie within the first 20min... I am just disappointed. Also, wtf is up with the ending? like did the writer and producer just quit on the spot the last 40min of the movie? I would like to know. To the producer and writers, please don't quit your bartender jobs. thx
This was one of the worst movies I've ever watched. Zero common sense to any of the decision making by the characters. Oh, and some of the worst acting ever. I want those 2 hours of my life back.
Lifetime movie at best. How did they get Dermot Mulroney to star in this garbage?!
Absolutely predictable.
I give this movie five, yes five well deserve poop emojis  💩💩💩💩💩
It's just...meh. They are shooting it as movie and just chopping into 40 minute episodes. It lacks the charm.
Acting and plot so bad that I fast forwarded to the end. When I saw the nanny holding a knife with a wack sound effect I was glad I didn't spend hours watching this trash.
What in the actual flying bleep did I just watch? Confusing ending, horrible never explained twists. Was Grace real or made up? Wtf?!
Horrible and stiff acting. Dumb plot. Totally predictable.
this movie was terrible.. To be honest I did not even finish it.

This feels and watches like one of those day time straight to movie films. The portrait of mental illness is absolutely abhorrent do films not have advisors anymore. Put this in I the background while washing the dishes

Can't believe how bad this movie was. Stale plot, terrible acting. Led by two aging actors. They hang all over each other the whole movie in a non-believable way. Crazy character did a decent job with having to work with a dog of a script. Even the way the scenes were shot were terrible. The plot didn't even make sense. The famous author helps fake nanny try on bras and after she finds out she is a fake lets her keep working? What a waste of time. It did finally put me to sleep.

Basically a Lifetime movie with undertones of black comedy and camp, this was entertaining and enjoyable to watch. It doesn't rise to the excellence of classic nanny thrillers like "The Hand That Rocks the Cradle."
Kristin Davis and Dermot Mulroney are great actors and Greer Grammar is enticing as the totally nut job nanny. The plot meanders along in the middle and ramps up at the end when a series of events happen in quick succession. Would be better if more twists and tones in the middle of the 2 hour movie. Would prefer that "Margaret" made a brief appearance earlier in the film, seems like an afterthought at the end. And (spoiler alert) the killing of the black best friend seemed cliche, gratuitous and unnecessary. The mystery could have unfolded more all along, and too much time was spent showing the 55+ aged middle aged couple rekindling their romance.  Mary's relationship with Grace was complex and fascinating, but again, the plot could have better defined it, instead of focusing on long melodic love scenes. Very interesting film, if you like the Lifetime feel, and it would be great to see Kristin Davis in many many more. The 3 of them were all great. Also it would have been better to show more of the relationship between the nanny and the husband, as again, that came at the end out of nowhere. Hints and brief moments of that earlier in the film could still have kept mystery yet made the plot stronger.
The acting is so bad that it's painful to watch.
this movie was recommended to me by a normie. that should have been a big red flag. do not recommend to your worst enemy.

l think I get this movie, and I think I like it.

The story here is not about Grace being a psycho killer. It's about Mary gradually devolving into madness. She is writing a novel, and she quickly begins to have trouble distinguishing between real life and the fiction she is writing. What happened between Grace and Mary occurred only in Mary's head. Finally, in the very last scene, we see someone we think is Mary leaving the hospital after visiting with someone we think is Grace. But her hair is covered, and we only see her from a distance (and overhead), so we can't really say definitively that it's Mary. And it isn't: it's Grace leaving the hospital after a visit with Mary, who is by now living out the story in her head 100% of the time. See this movie as not as a story about a woman told by an objective observer, but as a story based on reality as experienced by the  chaotic mind of a woman who can't tell the difference between her fantasies and reality.

This was so pitifully written. The acting is worse than a soap opera. The husband is a pathetic meat sack and the main character "AMAZING WRITER" from sex in the city can't act for toffee in this one! I know she's done great work in the past, but this isn't it. If this is a secret comedy, it's brilliant. Brilliantly bad.
oh come on, it wasn’t THAT bad. worth watching just to read the fan theories afterwards.

Time is precious and I can never get the time back. Makes 'The Room' look like a cinematic masterpiece.
Dermot, you were in Zodiac! Just sayin '.
This movie is stupid and makes no sense
Why does shit like this have to get made?
Excruciating to watch,

I think this is the worst movie I have ever seen.  I am baffled as to how it is #1 on Netflix right now.  Bad acting, bad plot, bad everything.  I'm shocked a cast such as this did so poorly.  I regret the time wasted watching it.  Pure trash.

Warning: save yourself 2 hours and do NOT watch this movie!!! It is complete garbage. Netflix was crazy to recommend this movie. The acting and "special effects" are horrible! How movies like this get funding is a complete mystery to me.

So, WTF was happening in this movie? While the trailers were sexy and intriguing, the actual movie let a lot to be desired...literally. I adore Kristin Davis, she's talented and amazing, but every line delivered by her or the other actors seemed fake and uninterested. I was hoping for so much with this movie and it fell so short. Disappointing all around.

This is sooooo bad. Kristin Davis and Dermot Mulroney must have needed the check! Kelsey Grammer had to have financed this so his daughter could get a job. Greer Grammer's performance is laughable. 2 hours wasted.

Very unclear,not my taste,if I could give zero I would... Don't recommended at all . Wasted all time . Hoped to having great movie night instead I got big disappointment.I didn't like it at all ,so sick and twisted ....
Neflix should make movies enjoyable and relaxing.I felt very uncomfortable to watch this one, really bad production.
This was absolutely horrible. Not only was it confusing but the acting and ending are terrible. Save yourself the time and watch something else.
If you truly liked this awful movie. Please delete your account on rotten tomatoes.

Please for the love of God do not watch this movie. I thought it would be an exciting  thriller that kind of messes with your head (which I normally love) and it was the opposite. They could have summed up the entire plot into 30 minutes yet the movie was 2 hours! 2 hours of my life I will never get back sadly. Acting, plot and everything else was absolutely horrible, not sure how it even got approved. Netflix tempts you with new movies right when you log on, but skip this one and watch something actually worth your time.
One of the worst movies ever. Run away!

Where to start... It was so monotone. Who picked the music? Why are there so many long scenes filled with Kristen Davis thoughtfully smoking  a cigar? Why did the screenwriter act like children can't hear people having sex in the main areas of the house while they're home? Are you saying Greer Grammar had DID with more than two personalities? Because,  in the end, she reverted to a child. AND if she's dangerous, how can she have visitor's, unsupervised, in her room?  Kristen Davis has blackouts, but yet, it's not addressed. There's just so much unexplained and not even eluded to, but yet, you can predict what's going to happen😹

this movie is the biggest waste of time. it makes you think the plot is thickening and something crazy is about to happen but actually is the cheesiest thing netflix has ever made. they plot had a potential maybe but they messed it all up.
I don't exactly know what the plot was to this movie and have more questions than answers.
script, direction, acting - this is what this film lacks.

One of the worst movies I have watched in a very long time. I don't know if it was the editing, the directing, the writing, or all three, but this movie is hot garbage. Kept waiting for it to turn into something else, and it just never does.
Horrible. One of the worst movies I've ever seen.
Terrible acting by Kristin Davis, and I found it predictable and trying to be a lot of other movies. It's watchable but not worth it.
More like "Deadly CONFUSION"  . It has many plot holes...much of it doesn't even make sense by the ending.
Oof, that was Rotten.
Nothing happens in the first hour that would keep your attention and the rest is just messy predictable garbage

Painfully hard to watch but after an hour of watching, I was committed to finish. It became more amusing to see how bad it could get.  The story was inconsistent, the acting was stiff, and it was so predictable.
Seriously the worst film I've ever watched.

It starts off like it could have potential but then nothing happens for about an hour. I couldn't figure out what the plot was other than the main character having writers block. The women are beautiful and nice to look at on a flat screen but that's about allthey have going for them as the acting was terrible with an even worse script. I honestly can't tell you what happened at the end. If you want to watch a similar movie but is actually worth your time, check out Nocturnal Animals.... I kind of think the director was going forsomething similar to Nocturnal but completely missed whatever he was setting to achieve.
A decent physical thriller, keeps you guessing if it's are really happening or if it's all in the protagonist head.
It was soo bad. Worse than the most cheesy, predictable, soap opera you have ever seen.

After reading all the other bad reviews, I had to watch it to see for myself and everyone was right, it was terrible. It was like a bad Lifetime movie. The acting was awful and the motivations made no sense. The fact that this garbage is the Number 1 movie on Netflix this week is unbelievable.
I honestly feel like this movie had potential if there was a different director and different editor/producer.

I don't know why this has such a low rating...unless Roger and/or Ebert is being paid to critique it, I firmly believe that the people's "thoughts" of this movie should be viewed from the perspective that this is a movie for entertainment...and this movie is entertaining. It's a little slow to start but mid-way through to the end pick up and left me feeling good about the movie. I hope people see this and realize that the "reviews" are meant to be for the everyday person and if it is enjoyable.

All the makings of a good thriller.   Good actors.   Good Story.  Visually appealing.   The problem with this one is it just doesn't work.   The script is the weak point.     The dialogue is not well written.   It seems forced in many places.    It is "clunky".   It reminds me of a much better movie, "Chloe, starring Amanda Seyfried and Julianne Moore.  There is a seductive quality to the film that makes it a compelling guilty pleasure.  Without giving away any spoilers I think the twists were very transparent throughout.  Shanola Hamption, of Shameless fame, is a standout in this one.  Aside from Shanola- very disappointing.
